commentary_data: "It was a shocker of a wicket", that's how Hardik Pandya had summarized the state of the wicket after India had a narrow win at the Ekana stadium in January against the visiting New Zealand side. The Ekana stadium is where the game will be played tonight. But the last game against Delhi saw plenty of runs being scored. LSG thumped DC to start proceedings in IPL 2023. But they were humbled by CSK a few days later. SRH on the other hand were handed a shellacking by RR in their opening encounter. Contrasting starts for both units but they would want two points from tonight's game, that's the common agenda for sure for both the teams.
I0$ Kyle Mayers with the bat and Mark Wood with the ball have been superb but haven't had much support from the others.
I0$ Nothing worked for them in their game against RR. Natarajan's bowling looked good though.
KL Rahul and the middle-order is due for runs. The bowling attack got some pounding against CSK but they would want to bounce back.
Almost everything. SRH need to shrug off the rust that was seen against RR. The senior cricketers have to take the mantle on themselves to deliver the goods.

We can't read too much into the head-to-head battles as well as they have squared off against each other only once. LSG won that encounter last year by 10 runs. The last two seasons have been poor for SRH and so much so that they had finished last in 2021 and ended up being 8th out of 10 teams in 2022. But they would want to bounce back and would want to do it soon. LSG were in the play-offs last season.

It has been great to come back. The guys are ready to get going. I have got a role tonight. I can't tell you what it is. I have played a handful of games here. Every time I have played here, it has been a little different. I think it is about assessing the conditions as qucikly as you can and executing your plans. I don't really practice that much when I am in form. Just hit a couple of balls and take some catches.

I am happy that I have given the responsibility of leading the spinners. I am trying to keep them quiet. I am trying to put the balls in the right areas. I am trying nothing different. You get wickets some days and some days you don't.

When you move to black soil, there is less pace and bounce. There are less blades of grass on this. There shouldn't be any dew as well. All the teams have wanted to chase in the IPL so far. There should be less spin compared to red soil wicket.
We will look to bat first. The wicket looks dry. Ideally we will get to our first win. The guys are looking excited. There are two changes. One of them is me.

Too early to say anything. We ended up batting well in the last game. We will look to adjust and play well tonight. We can come in with a set plan as we are playing for the first time here. Wood has the flu and will miss out. Avesh is taking a break as he got himself injured. We will look to be aggressive and get the wickets.
(Playing XI): KL Rahul(c), Kyle Mayers, Deepak Hooda, Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran(w), Romario Shepherd, Krunal Pandya, Amit Mishra, Yash Thakur, Jaydev Unadkat, Ravi Bishnoi
(Playing XI): Mayank Agarwal, Anmolpreet Singh(w), Rahul Tripathi, Aiden Markram(c), Harry Brook, Washington Sundar, Abdul Samad, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, T Natarajan, Umran Malik, Adil Rashid
Ayush Badoni, Swapnil Singh, Daniel Sams, Prerak Mankad, Avesh Khan
Heinrich Klaasen, Fazalhaq Farooqi, Mayank Markande, Mayank Dagar, Marco Jansen
QdK mentioned he has got a role tonight but can't disclose it. Hmmm, looking at the team sheet, it seems he has got the role of a spectator tonight.
The umpires have walked out. LSG players are out there. SRH openers come into the ground as well. Mayers has the ball in his hands. About to roll...

Mayers to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run, little bit of movement and the ball keeps low for the batter to turn the ball down behind square for a single. Angled in from over the wicket as the bowler went wide of the crease
Mayers to Mayank, 1 run, stabs a length delivery into the off-side and they get a single. That was outside off and Mayank patted it down past the fielder to steal a single
Mayers to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run, length delivery, angles in, the batter looks to tuck it and misses I guess. Got an inside edge and they hared through for a single
Mayers to Mayank, 1 run, keeps low, angles in, Mayank manages to tuck that down to deep mid for a single
Mayers to Anmolpreet Singh, no run, gets the ball to angle in from a length and the batter gets his bat down to pat it away to mid-on

Mayers to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run, angles it in from a length and Anmolpreet Singh tucks it wide of long-on for a single. That wasn't a pacy delivery and Anmolpreet Singh had enough time to play it off the back foot
SRH have kept all options open with their impact sub by going with only three overseas in the original XI. This is quite a smart use of the rule!
Unadkat to Anmolpreet Singh, no run, angles across a fuller length delivery and Anmolpreet Singh drives it but finds the man at cover. That was not timed nor placed by Anmolpreet Singh

Unadkat to Anmolpreet Singh, 2 runs, whips the ball away off the pads but the slowness of the track doesn't allow him to get it away. The ball lands short of the man at deep backward. They get a brace. The wicket is pretty slow and can't see it quickening up as well
Unadkat to Anmolpreet Singh, no run, length delivery, Anmolpreet Singh stabs the pull down and finds the man at mid-wicket. Again no sense on timing on it

Unadkat to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run, bottom-hands the drive off the cue-end of the bat and dives into his crease to make it as the throw came in from the man at mid-off. Was a fuller ball, angled across, Anmolpreet Singh got a stride out and looked to punch it but struggled for timing on it

Unadkat to Mayank, 1 run, and the fumble by the man at mid-off allows a safe single. Was a length delivery, Mayank stabbed it to mid-off and set off. The fielder was culprit of watching the batter I suppose and took his eyes off at the last second to fumble it

Unadkat to Mayank, 1 run, and the fumble by the man at mid-off allows a safe single. Was a length delivery, Mayank stabbed it to mid-off and set off. The fielder was culprit of watching the batter I suppose and took his eyes off at the last second to fumble it

Unadkat to Anmolpreet Singh, , and that has travelled alright! Was banged in short, Anmolpreet Singh swivelled on the back foot to pull it. Got a bit of a top-edge I reckon but that flew well over the fine leg fence. Travelled really high and far
Krunal Pandya to Mayank, no run, flatter one from the tweaker and at the sticks, patted back to the bowler. KL is quick to realize that the deck is slow
Krunal Pandya to Mayank, , sits down and gets it over the man at 45 degrees for a four. Was down on to his pads, he kneeled down and managed to get under the ball to lift it over the infield
Krunal Pandya to Mayank, 1 run, tucks the ball away on to the on-side for a single
Krunal Pandya to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run, keeps it at the sticks, inside-halves the ball away on to the on-side for a single
Krunal Pandya to Mayank,  Caught!!

Krunal Pandya to Mayank,  Caught by Stoinis!! A soft dismissal. Not the first one you will see tonight. Got a big stride forward, looked to drive it aerially but failed to get it over the man at cover. Just a friendly chip and the man at cover leapt a little to take it. Easy take to send back Mayank. Was a tossed up delivery, outside off, the ball held on to the surface a little and Mayank was a little early into the shot.

Krunal Pandya to Tripathi, no run, quicker one, angles in, keeps low, Tripathi bends down quickly and manages to cue-end it. The keeper appeals as he feels it went off the bat, then the batter's boot and was taken by the slip fielder. But I guess he realized it went to ground and not on to the boot

Unadkat to Anmolpreet Singh, no run, tch tch! Sorry state of affairs as far as the wicket is concerned. That snails and snakes to the keeper as the batter is undone on the pull. Was a slower delivery and kept very low to outdo the batter
Unadkat to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run, pats the ball down to mid-off and scampers off for a single. The wicket here will again make some headlines...
Unadkat to Tripathi, no run, angles it across, Tripathi pats the ball down into the off-side and doesn't get a single
Unadkat to Tripathi, no run, slower delivery, slants it across, Tripathi stabs the ball down to find the man at point who is in by a few yards
Mayank's poor run in IPL from last year continues.....
Unadkat to Tripathi, 1 run, pat and run to another slower delivery angled across. The batter hit it and set off. Anmolpreet Singh was a little late to react. Sadly,
Unadkat to Anmolpreet Singh, , banged in short but miles wide outside off and the batter lets it go to earn that extra run. As a batter you would take everything and anything extra on this wicket
Unadkat to Anmolpreet Singh, no run, charges down the track and mistimes the shot down to mid-off
Krunal Pandya to Tripathi, no run, gets squared up and defends it out into the off-side
Krunal Pandya to Tripathi, 1 run, pats the ball down to mid-off for a single as that was on the sticks
Krunal Pandya to Tripathi, 1 run, pats the ball down to mid-off for a single as that was on the sticks
Krunal Pandya to Anmolpreet Singh, no run, quicker one, arrows in, Anmolpreet Singh looks to tuck it and gets an inside edge as the ball rolls down on to the deck
Krunal Pandya to Anmolpreet Singh, no run, spears one in, the batter gets his bat down and pats that wide of the bowler but they don't get a single

Krunal Pandya to Anmolpreet Singh, , angles it in, nice timing from Anmolpreet Singh earns him a four. The bat came down at an angle and he managed to punch that wide of mid-on for a four. Lovely timing and placement

Krunal Pandya to Anmolpreet Singh, , poor bowling from Krunal Pandya as he strays on to the pads of the batter. Anmolpreet Singh sits down and sweeps the ball over square leg for a four. That was well executed as he saw the fielder being inside the circle
Yash Thakur to Tripathi, , walks across, sits down, waits on the delivery and laps it over short fine. Had the time to preempt the shot. Got inside the line of the ball and put it away with elan
Yash Thakur to Tripathi, 1 run, walks across his sticks again and looks to paddle it. The ball comes off the cue-end of the bat and they scamper through for a single

A very late review call by Anmolpreet Singh. That kept low as he missed the pull and the umpire's finger went up. Slower delivery, the batter was too early into the pull and missed it. Only thing is height which can save the batter. He has missed it by miles, so no chance of an inside edge. It is indeed going over. Anmolpreet Singh will survive
Looks like a sluggish track. Low scoring game on our hands tonight

Yash Thakur to Anmolpreet Singh, no run, Hawkeye shows it won't be dipping that much and Anmolpreet Singh has Tripathi to thank as his partner coaxed him to take the review with very few seconds left on the clock. That was a length delivery and Anmolpreet Singh went for the pull but got fooled by the lack of pace on it
Yash Thakur to Anmolpreet Singh, no run, and stabs the pull back to the bowler as that was at the sticks
Don't know what innovation this impact rule brings, but this is so confusing. Even the captains are not sure of their teams and strategies.
Yash Thakur to Anmolpreet Singh, , poor delivery from Yash Thakur and put away easily. Was a fuller ball and Anmolpreet Singh clipped it past mid-on for a four. Lovely timing on it
Yash Thakur to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run, jumps on to the short ball and pulls the ball down to deep square for a single
The first six overs will have more words about the pitch rather than the action so far. It would be tough to score on this deck.
Ravi Bishnoi to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run, dragged down on to the pads, pulled down to deep backward for a single
Ravi Bishnoi to Tripathi, no run, keeps very low and has been stabbed back to the bowler as that was flatter outside off
Ravi Bishnoi to Tripathi, 1 run, well tossed up delivery, outside off, Tripathi drills that down to deep cover for a single
Ravi Bishnoi to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run, googly and turns in, Anmolpreet Singh goes back and tucks it down to deep mid for a single
Ravi Bishnoi to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run, googly and turns in, Anmolpreet Singh goes back and tucks it down to deep mid for a single
Ravi Bishnoi to Tripathi, 1 run, looks to drive and gets an inside edge on to the on-side for a single. Wanted to play that on the off-side and ended up sending it behind square on the on-side
Ravi Bishnoi to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run, punches the ball down to long-on for a single. SRH won't be that disappointed with the start as the wicket has played some tricks so far

Krunal Pandya to Anmolpreet Singh, 1 run, spoons it over the bowler who ran back but failed to get there. The ball spun a little and held on to the surface a little as he tried to tuck that away on to the on-side
"Why mark wood is not playing today. I hope there's no any injury concern." -- Wood is unwell
Krunal Pandya to Tripathi, no run, kneels down and looks to slog sweep. Was hit outside the line of the sticks and hence the appeal was turned down
Krunal Pandya to Tripathi, no run, a risky shot for nothing. Went back, backed away, took it from the sticks to cut it but found the man at point
Krunal Pandya to Tripathi, 1 run, stabs the ball down with soft hands into the off-side for a single

Tripathi once again feels Anmolpreet Singh should review and he has. That was angled in and Anmolpreet Singh missed the tuck. The ball kept a little low and escaped the wood. Is it clipping the sticks? There is no bat confirms the UltraEdge. It is just about clipping the sticks. They lose Anmolpreet Singh but retain the review.
Krunal Pandya to Anmolpreet Singh,  Lbw!!

Krunal Pandya to Anmolpreet Singh,  Lbw!! End of a decent knock I would reckon as batting hasn't been easy on this track. That was a flatter one, angled in and Anmolpreet Singh missed the tuck. The ball hit the back pad and was going on to clip the sticks. The onfield call was out and hence the original call stood. Important strike for LSG.
Krunal Pandya to Markram,  Bowled!!

Krunal Pandya to Markram,  Bowled!! That's not beginner's luck for sure. Pitches, turns and the off-pole is lying flat on the deck. Markram pauses a little before realizing he is gone for a golden duck. That was a tossed up delivery, Markram didn't cover the line and looked to drive. The ball turned past the willow and turned enough to crash into the off-stick. Krunal has his third.
Ravi Bishnoi to Tripathi, 1 run, angles it in from wide of the crease and tucks it down into the on-side for a single
Markram didn't move his feet much and paid the price for it. He could have been a little more committed to the shot.
Ravi Bishnoi to Harry Brook, 1 run, stays low, hangs back and tucks the ball down on to the on-side for a single
Ravi Bishnoi to Tripathi, 1 run, a googly outside off and the batter waits on it and pats the ball down into the off-side for a single
Ravi Bishnoi to Harry Brook, 2 runs, dances down the track and fetches it from outside off to send it back past the bowler for a couple of runs. Good use of the feet by the young man
Ravi Bishnoi to Harry Brook, 2 runs, dances down the track and fetches it from outside off to send it back past the bowler for a couple of runs. Good use of the feet by the young man
Ravi Bishnoi to Harry Brook, no run, quicker one, skids through and was at the sticks. Harry Brook pats it down into the deck
Ravi Bishnoi to Harry Brook,  Stumped!!

Ravi Bishnoi to Harry Brook,  Stumped!! Brook's intent won't work tonight. That wasn't the googly, Harry Brook danced down blind and missed the line of the ball to be out stumped. That turned away ever so slightly for the batter to be dismissed. Fourth one down for SRH. They are in deep trouble now. The batter tried to preempt the delivery but it went away for him to be out stumped.

SRH in a deep hole now. Time-out has come at the right time for them. They have lost their last three in a quick span. The wicket has assisted spinners and has kept low as well. Even 130 will be a challenging total but will SRH be able to score that much?
Hooda to Tripathi, 1 run, delays his push drive and gets it away from the man at cover for a single
Hooda to Washington Sundar, 1 run, lures it up, Washington Sundar waits on it and tucks the ball down on to the on-side for a single

Hooda to Tripathi, 1 run, flatter one, outside off, the batter sits down and looks to sweep but ends up getting an inside edge for a single. The bowler realized that there was an inside edge and the appeal was aborted
Hooda to Washington Sundar, 1 run, gets forward and pushes it down to long-off for a single
Hooda to Tripathi, no run, the ball turns in and has been chopped down to the man at point

Hooda to Tripathi, , that's a superb shot! Top shot from a talented player. Was outside off, Tripathi opened the bat face and managed to get it past the man at point for a four. There isn't pace off the deck but Tripathi did well to infuse enough power into the shot
Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, no run, keeps treacherously low outside off and Washington Sundar hangs his bat to inside-edge it down to short fine
Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, 1 run, lunges forward and nudges the ball off the pads for a single on to the on-side
Ravi Bishnoi to Tripathi, no run, drops it short, outside off, the ball stays low and has been stabbed down to cover
Ravi Bishnoi to Tripathi, 1 run, well played by Tripathi as he takes it from the sticks and nudges the ball down to mid-wicket. They thought of a couple before Tripathi sent Washington Sundar back

Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, no run, tossed up googly, the batter looks to clip it and misses. Was beaten in flight but that landed outside leg. The ball ricocheted on to the off-side and Tripathi wanted a single but was sent back
Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, no run, tossed up delivery, Washington Sundar gets forward and pushes the ball down to cover
Yash Thakur to Tripathi, 1 run, starts with a short ball at the sticks, pulled down to deep backward for a single. Yash Thakur was a little expensive in his first over
Yash Thakur to Washington Sundar, no run, back of a length delivery, punched back to the bowler
SRH will have to go after Yash. Their rate is less than 6 per over now.
Yash Thakur to Washington Sundar, 1 run, gets forward and pats the ball past point for a single
Yash Thakur to Tripathi, no run, slower, short ball and Tripathi looks to cut it and misses. That was very slow and Tripathi failed to make any sort of contact
Yash Thakur to Tripathi, 1 run, no signs on timing as the batter pulls that down to deep mid for a single. That was dropped short by Yash Thakur
Yash Thakur to Washington Sundar, 1 run, gets forward to a length delivery and pats it down to mid-off for a single. That was done pretty well by Washington Sundar
Mishra to Washington Sundar, 1 run, well doled up delivery outside off and has been driven into the covers for a single. Was tossed up well outside off
Mishra to Tripathi, no run, lovely dip, lovely flight and beats the poke outside off. There was some puff of dust as well when it landed
Mishra to Tripathi, 1 run, sits down and looks to sweep to get an inside edge on to the on-side for a single
Mishra to Washington Sundar, no run, keeps very low and has been punched off the back foot to cover
Mishra to Washington Sundar, no run, well tossed up delivery, Washington Sundar gets forward and pushes it out to cover
Mishra to Washington Sundar, 1 run, that was dropped short, Washington Sundar goes back, stays low and pulls that down to deep mid for a single
Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, , leg spinner but goes down the leg side.  Nothing on Snicko and stays down the leg side, review wasted!
Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, 1 run, googly going outside off, Sundar turns it behind square on the leg side for a single
Ravi Bishnoi to Tripathi, 1 run, flighted up around off. Tripathi with a tap and run towards point
Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, no run, googly that zips outside off, beats Sundar who was really surprised by the pace on that as it turned away
Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, no run, googly that zips outside off, beats Sundar who was really surprised by the pace on that as it turned away
Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, no run, another googly and once again Sundar beaten on the outside edge. This time beaten trying to drive
Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, 1 run, pitched up on off, Sundar leans closer to block towards short cover and Tripathi is keen to complete the single. They get home without much trouble
Ravi Bishnoi to Tripathi, no run, flighted up and straight, defended on the leg side

This pitch has been a curve ball for SRH and now they need to think of a Plan B. Tripathi and Sundar have gotten defensive to arrest the flow of wickets, and this is a tough wicket to score freely on. A few calculated risks needed from now on though to get SRH a fighting first innings total
Mishra to Washington Sundar, 1 run, flighted up generously on off, driven to long-off
Mishra to Tripathi, no run, googly from a length. Punched back to Mishra off the backfoot
Mishra to Tripathi, no run, slow on off, Tripathi waits and eternity to sweep and ends up sweeping it onto his pads
Mishra to Tripathi, 1 run, tossed outside off, Tripathi chips it over extra cover for a single
Mishra to Washington Sundar, 1 run, flatter length on the pads, clipped towards deep mid-wicket
SRH just need to calm down and back themselves to get 2 good overs. At the moment should at least run singles and doubles and minimize dot balls.
Mishra to Tripathi, ,  A gift from Amit Mishra as he tosses up under the bat of Tripathi who slams it over the bowler's head for a straight boundary
Krunal Pandya to Washington Sundar, no run, full and quicker onto off, defended towards point
So finally we have a pitch where 140 could be a good target to defend.
Krunal Pandya to Washington Sundar, no run, flat, cut straight to backward point
Krunal Pandya to Washington Sundar, no run, short again, cut again but towards the fielder again
Krunal Pandya to Washington Sundar, 1 run, shorter length onto off, pulled towards deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Tripathi, no run, arm ball, blocked to the leg side but Pandya is quick to curb the attempt of a single
Krunal Pandya to Tripathi, no run, quicker and fuller on middle, Tripathi presents a solid defence.
Mishra to Washington Sundar, 1 run, googly onto leg, clipped towards deep mid-wicket
Mishra to Washington Sundar, 1 run, googly onto leg, clipped towards deep mid-wicket
Mishra to Tripathi, no run, slow outside off, Tripathi cuts it but in the direction of backward point
Mishra to Tripathi, 1 run, shorter slow delivery, doesn't rise up enough at all. Pulled towards long-on
Mishra to Washington Sundar, 1 run, googly onto middle, tucked towards deep square leg. Tripathi wanted a second run but Sundar sent him back
These pitches are so extreme. Either 200+ is not enough or 130+ is an extremely good score. Miss the days of 165 competitive games.
Mishra to Tripathi, ,  Tripathi anticipates the wide tossed up delivery and plays a reverse sweep over the infield, over backward point for a boundary!!
Mishra to Tripathi, byes, 1 run, tossed up outside off again, Tripathi goes for a big slog towards the leg side and misses. Keeper Pooran has a fumble and the batters steal the bye
Yash Thakur to Tripathi, 2 runs, gentle length ball, keeps low. Pulled to the left of deep square leg for a couple of runs
Yash Thakur to Tripathi,  Caught!!

Yash Thakur to Tripathi,  Caught by Mishra!! Banged in short but no pace on this surface and comes gently outside off. Tripathi tries to ramp it over short third but the lace of pace means he gets a very meak connection. Amit Mishra is the fielder in the circle who quickly shuffles to his left and takes a diving catch. Who said T20 was a young man's game?
Yash Thakur to Abdul Samad, , banged in short at regulation pace, Abdul Samad plays a first ball pull between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket. Starts with a boundary!!
Yash Thakur to Abdul Samad, 1 run, good length cutter outside off, pushed towards the sweeper
Yash Thakur to Washington Sundar, 1 run, another slower delivery. Sundar thought of the slog but decides to gently push it towards wide long-on for a single
Yash Thakur to Abdul Samad, 2 runs, good length and doesn't rise as much, Samad went for a heave and inside edged it towards fine leg. Mayers cuts it off and the batters take a couple
Amit Mishra bowling the penultimate over of the game. Tells you everything about this pitch!!
Mishra to Washington Sundar, 1 run, tossed up and slightly wider, driven towards long-on
Mishra to Abdul Samad, 1 run, tossed up, Samad inside halves his slog tamely towards square leg
Mishra to Washington Sundar,  Caught!!

Mishra to Washington Sundar,  Caught by Hooda!! The first real big shot from Washington Sundar and he holes out!! Gently tossed up again, Sundar had to take it on. Gets a good enough connection towards long-on but these are big straight boundaries. Deepak Hooda is the fielder and he doesn't drop these kind of catches.

Mishra to Washington Sundar,  Caught by Hooda!! The first real big shot from Washington Sundar and he holes out!! Gently tossed up again, Sundar had to take it on. Gets a good enough connection towards long-on but these are big straight boundaries. Deepak Hooda is the fielder and he doesn't drop these kind of catches.
Mishra to Adil Rashid, , once again the new man gets a first ball four. Flighted with width, Rashid slams his drive through deep extra cover. Between the two deep fielders and goes for four...
Mishra to Adil Rashid, no run, googly this time and keeps low. Rashid can't connect on the clip
Mishra to Adil Rashid,  Caught!!
Mishra to Adil Rashid,  Caught by Hooda!! Tossed up delivery again, Adil Rashid danced out and went for a big drive down the ground. Catching practice for Deepak Hooda at long-off.
Unadkat to Abdul Samad,  Run Out!!

Unadkat to Abdul Samad,  Umran Malik Run Out!! 1 run completed Full outside off, comes slower than expected as Samad was through his drive early. Goes tamely past the bowler towards long-on. Umran Malik tries to go for a selfless second run but runs himself out. b]Umran Malik run out (Hooda/Unadkat) 0(0)[/b]
Unadkat to Abdul Samad, , this could be very valuable!! Slower back of length delivery outside off. Abdul Samad takes it on and pulls it over long-on for a maximum. Came off the sweet spot
Unadkat to Abdul Samad, no run, shorter length and keeps low, goes under Abdul Samad's slog
Unadkat to Abdul Samad, no run, slow length ball outside off. Abdul Samad shufles in to slam it away but cuts it into the pitch. Dot ball

Unadkat to Abdul Samad, , superb striking!! This was another pace off back of length delivery. Samad waits a long time and releases his pull at the right moment. Over deep mid-wicket and into the stands...
Unadkat to Abdul Samad, no run, full outside off, a swing and a miss for Abdul Samad. Innings ends with a dot ball.

The Border-Gavaskar Trophy got over last month but looks like noone gave the memo to the Lucknow pitch curators. A sluggish surface that is keeping low, absolutely no pace on the wicket!! And as expected the spinners ruled the roost, with Krunal Pandya being the pick of the bowlers with 3/18. He got Mayank Agarwal early and then dismissed Anmolpreet Singh and Markram in the same over. SRH struggled to get going on this sluggish surface, as Tripathi and Washington Sundar went more defensive. It was also a surface that saw the return of an evergreen IPL figure, as Amit Mishra picked up two wickets while bowling out. Abdul Samad came out and smashed two sixes in the final over, and those could be very valuable runs. A tacky surface, this could be a tricky chase. Something different today in the IPL...
Rahul Tripathi , Fazalhaq Farooqi

It was a tough wicket for batters. Our bowlers bowled well according to the conditions. It is a dicey score. We will look to finish it well and early. I knew Brook will step out. I was ready as he had stepped out earlier in the over. I thought I will trick him with a leggie. Samad finished well for them. Our batters should chase this down.
This was Amit Mishra's first IPL outing since 2021, he'd played just four matches that season.
Bhuvneshwar to Mayers, no run, good length and swings inwards to the pads. Slower than expected and Mayers gets beaten trying to clip it leg side
Bhuvneshwar to Mayers, 1 run, good length and nips in towards the thigh pad. Mayers with a tap and run towards mid-on
Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, , a klassy shot from KL!! This was slightly pitched up, Rahul shimmies forward and plays a very well balanced cover drive through the gap for a boundary...
Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, , oops! These won't work when you're defending 122. Shoddy keeping as Bhuvneshwar loses his line and goes down leg. Keeps a bit low and goes under Anmolpreet
Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, 1 run, back of length and wider, Rahul gets a thick edge towards third-man
Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, 1 run, back of length and wider, Rahul gets a thick edge towards third-man
Bhuvneshwar to Mayers, no run, good length and leaves Mayers outside off. One bounce towards the keeper
A catching mid-wicket in place

Bhuvneshwar to Mayers, 2 runs, full and straight, Mayers charged out and lifts his flick high in the air. Safe though as it falls well to the right of Natarjan who was running in from deep backward square leg
Interesting choice in Fazalhaq, given the ball is gripping wouldn't Mayank Markande been a right choice?
Washington Sundar to Rahul, , lovely drive!! A poor overpitched delivery with width from Sundar and KL Rahul plays a superb drive through extra cover for a boundary
Washington Sundar to Rahul, 1 run, yorker length delivery, stabbed out towards long-on
Here's the match-up. Mayers vs off-spin. Something has got to give...
Washington Sundar to Mayers, 1 run, flat and just outside off, punched a tad uppishly towards long-off
Washington Sundar to Rahul, 1 run, full and quicker, Rahul turns his drive towards long-on
Washington Sundar to Mayers, , pitched up on off, quicker again. Mayers plays the cover drive and gets it to the left of the fielder in the circle. Runs away for four...
Washington Sundar to Mayers, no run, flat and comes in with the arm, keeps low and raps Mayers on the pads
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Rahul, no run, good length onto leg, turned towards mid-wicket
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Rahul, no run, good length and skids towards off. Pushed towards covers
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Rahul, no run, good length and skiddy onto middle. Fended away towards the off side
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Rahul, 1 run, good length just outside off, Rahul tries to cut and edges it onto his boots and deflects tamely towards point. Single taken...

Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mayers, , slower length ball outside off, Mayers waits and waits, and then opens the bat surface to dab it towards third-man for a boundary. The short third fielder probably had a chance if he commited to the drive
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mayers, no run, good length and skids just outside off. Mayers beaten on the outside edge. Goes one bounce to the keeper.
Markram to Rahul, no run, short and spins in, tucked towards mid-wicket
Markram to Rahul, no run, a tad fuller and straight, pushed to mid-on
Markram to Rahul, , straying onto the pads, Rahul gets onto one knee and flicks it behind square. One bounce and four...
Venkatesh SRH management seems to be taking all the wrong steps.
Markram to Rahul, 1 run, tossed up, Rahul goes for the big drive but doesn't time it. Goes tamely towards long-on
Markram to Mayers, no run, flat and outside off, cut straight to the point fielder
Markram to Mayers, 1 run, flighted up, driven to long-off
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mayers, no run, hard length and Mayers was a bit early on the pull. Lobs off his thigh pad onto the pitch
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mayers, no run, back of a length goes over the off stump, under Mayers' pull
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mayers,  Caught!!

Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mayers,  Caught by Mayank!! Big, big wicket!! This was a back of length delivery on off again. Mayers shuffles in to play the big pull. There was one man in the deep at deep square leg, and Mayers holes out to him. After two fifties, Kyle Mayers is gone cheaply today.
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hooda, , good length and felt like it went over leg stump as Hooda shuffled in. Umpire thinks it was down leg though
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hooda, 1 run, full on off from round the wicket. Hooda turns his bat face on the drive to get it wide of mid-off
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Rahul, 1 run, length ball outside off, cut into the ground towards point for a single
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hooda, byes, 1 run, back of length and angles in, keeping lower than expected. Beats Hooda on the inside edge and foxes the keeper as well, who fumbles to allow a bye
Ady That's the truth since the 2021 Season! That feud with Warner and then releasing him and Rashid, what were they thinking?
Bhuvneshwar to Hooda, , full and straight, no swing. Hooda dances out and lifts his drive very easily over the bowler's head. Lands short of the sightscreen...
Bhuvneshwar to Hooda, no run, on a length and straight. Hooda stepped out again but chooses to defend
Bhuvneshwar to Hooda, no run, fuller on off, blocked to short cover
Bhuvneshwar to Hooda, no run, fuller on off, blocked to short cover
Bhuvneshwar to Hooda, no run, on a length outside off, a bit of wobble. Hooda has a swing and a miss
Bhuvneshwar to Hooda, no run, full and angling inwards, blocked to mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Hooda,  Caught&Bowled!!

Bhuvneshwar to Hooda,  Caught&Bowled!! Gone! What a solid comeback by Bhuvi Kumar. Went for a six first ball but followed it up with four dots and a wicket. This was a length ball that got a bit of extra bounce, Hooda stepped out and was stuck in the middle, chipped it back to the bowler. A nice one-handed catch low to his left by the bowler. SRH need to keep the wickets coming...

*Bhuvaneshwar Kumar starts off on a poor note and concedes 13 off the first over.
*Sundar also is expensive and gives away 11.
* Rahul and Mayers get LSG off to a solid start.
* Farooqi removes Mayers
*Kumar removes Hooda off the last ball of the powerplay period.
Adil Rashid to Rahul, 2 runs, tossed up and a bit wider, Rahul plays the square drive for a couple of runs
Adil Rashid to Rahul, , shorter length on off. Rahul gets back and punches it through deep extra cover. There was a sweeper in place but always kept running away from him
Not to forget, SRH doesn't have a specialist keeper today. They are doing with a stand-in Anmolpreet
Adil Rashid to Rahul, 1 run, gentle length ball that spins away from off, punched towards long-off
Adil Rashid to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slow and was the googly. Pandya waits for the turn and pushes to point to get off the mark
Adil Rashid to Rahul, no run, flighted and spins outside off. Rahul retracts his bat and leaves it alone
Adil Rashid to Rahul, 2 runs, pushed quicker on off, Rahul gets a thick edge past first slip for a couple of runs as Umran from short third chases after it

Markram to Krunal Pandya, no run, length ball sliding in on off from round the wicket, Krunal tries to guide it with an open face into the off-side, ends up chopping it off a thick inside edge down the pitch
Markram to Krunal Pandya, , steps out, meets the pitch of this delivery and drives very sweetly through extra cover. Key was how well he used his feet to get to the ball
Markram to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, dragged down short outside off, Krunal cuts hard but the fielder gets a hand diving across at point

Markram to Rahul, 1 run, ! Floated up from round the wicket, lands around a length and goes on with the arm. Rahul was playing for some turn, and he nicks it behind. But it's a healthy edge that gives the keeper no chance. There's no slip either to latch onto the deflection
Markram to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, dances down and lofts it inside-out over extra cover! Wasn't quite to the pitch so hasn't middled it! But it clears the infield comfortably
Markram to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, dances down and lofts it inside-out over extra cover! Wasn't quite to the pitch so hasn't middled it! But it clears the infield comfortably
Markram to Krunal Pandya, no run, defended
Adil Rashid to Rahul, 1 run, length ball turning away outside off, Rahul knocks it through cover
Adil Rashid to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
Adil Rashid to Rahul, 1 run, floated up on middle, Rahul looks to defend and gets a thick inside edge into the on-side
Adil Rashid to Krunal Pandya, no run, googly across middle, Krunal pushes it to cover
Adil Rashid to Krunal Pandya, no run, floated up outside off, turns in off a length, Krunal looks to cut but it stays a touch low. He chops it back down the pitch
Adil Rashid to Krunal Pandya, ,  Again good use of the feet from Krunal, helping him get right to the pitch of this flighted legbreak. And he follows it with a lovely swing through the line
Timeout!

T Natarajan to Rahul, byes, 1 run, another fumble from the keeper. He's having a tough time. Back of a length outside off, Rahul misses an attempted cut and it bounces just in front of Anmolpreet who can't gather it cleanly
T Natarajan to Krunal Pandya, no run, 134.6kph, good length delivery just outside off, Krunal presses forward and drives back to Natarajan

T Natarajan to Krunal Pandya, , oh dear! Terrible from Umran in the deep! He goes for a one-handed pick-up but misses it completely, and the ball sneaks through for four! Slower length ball cutting in on off, Krunal backs away, makes room and drives nicely through extra cover. Should've only been two, but
These kind of chases are Rahul's bread and butter. Lucknow will do well to keep similar pitches for rest of the tournament.
T Natarajan to Krunal Pandya, , down the leg-side, wide called
T Natarajan to Krunal Pandya, no run, slower one around off, Krunal defends forward
T Natarajan to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, good length outside off, Krunal drives hard and extra cover dives forward for the catch. But it bounces well short, and he fails to cut it off either
T Natarajan to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, half-volley down the leg-side, Krunal flicks it away behind square for a couple

SRH will always struggle on Indian pitches. They have a foreign dominated middle- order. They will struggle on their home ground too against slower balls & spin. They used to strangle teams using Rashid, Bhuvi & Kaul with spin, slower ones & knuckle balls, same might happen to them this time.
Mid-on, mid-off both in the ring as Umran comes on
Umran Malik to Rahul, no run, back of a length on middle, Rahul hangs back and blocks
Umran Malik to Rahul, no run, back of a length on middle, Rahul hangs back and blocks
Umran Malik to Rahul, 1 run, 141.4kph, back of a length just outside off, Rahul punches it gently to the left of mid-off for a single
Umran Malik to Krunal Pandya, no run, back of a length delivery slanted in from round the wicket, Krunal tries punching firmly off the back foot but mistimes it in front of mid-on
Umran Malik to Krunal Pandya, no run, 143.1kph, speared in full around off, Krunal drives to mid-off

Umran Malik to Krunal Pandya, , another mistake from Anmolpreet behind the stumps. Length ball down leg, Anmolpreet dives across but it hits him on the wrist. It's a wide and they've run a couple as well
Umran Malik to Krunal Pandya, , back of a length delivery slanted in on middle, sits up nicely around the waist and Krunal pulls it through midwicket for four
Umran Malik to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, good length around off, Krunal pushes it wide of mid-on and scampers through
T Natarajan to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, 134.3kph, good length around off, Krunal steps away from the stumps and slaps it to deep point
T Natarajan to Rahul, 2 runs, slower length ball just outside off, Rahul punches it firmly through extra cover and gets back for two
T Natarajan to Rahul, 1 run, 131.7kph, good length ball slanted in on off, Rahul punches it to long-off
Hyderabad needs to find the right balance quickly.. Loads of individual talents but just need to set up a right rhythm!
T Natarajan to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, Krunal moves around in the crease, Natarajan nails the yorker around off and it's squeezed away through backward point for a single
T Natarajan to Rahul, no run, 130.7kph, good length outside off, Rahul gets forward and pushes to cover
T Natarajan to Rahul, no run, slower length ball on off, Rahul turns it to midwicket

This SRH is reminding of the old Daredevils team ,best of players at disposal, still messing up with the combinations and strategies. It would be a big disappointment if SRH doesnâ€™t make it to the playoffs, they were deemed as favourites leading up to this season.
Umran Malik to Krunal Pandya, , 146.5kph from Umran, and Krunal just plants his front foot down the pitch and smashes it over mid-off!
Umran Malik to Krunal Pandya,  Caught!!

Umran Malik to Krunal Pandya,  Caught by Anmolpreet Singh!! Something to cheer for Umran. Good length outside off, it's at high pace and Krunal's feet go nowhere. He throws his bat at it, and nicks it through to Anmolpreet who hangs on. Umran spreads his arms and then punches the air enthusiastically.
Umran Malik to Stoinis, , misdirected down the leg-side, and Anmolpreet isn't able to get to it. Runs away for five wides
Certainly Anmolpreet's last outing with the gloves atleast for the season. Did so well with the bat on this surface but unfortunately for him undoing a lot of it now.
Umran Malik to Stoinis, , again he strays in line. Length ball down leg, Stoinis hangs back and tickles it fine for four. Easy peasy
Umran Malik to Stoinis, no run, good length at the stumps, defended from the crease
Umran Malik to Stoinis, no run, good length at the stumps, defended from the crease
Umran Malik to Stoinis, no run, full and wide, left alone
Umran Malik to Stoinis, no run, 137kph, good length on off, defended to point
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Rahul, 1 run, good length outside off, Rahul drives sweetly to sweeper cover
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Stoinis, no run, overpitched on middle, Stoinis flicks to midwicket
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Stoinis, no run, back of a length on middle, Stoinis blocks
Bit of a tricky situation for Stoinis. Doesn't have much to gain from this innings, but can't afford to get out cheaply. De Kock is waiting in the wings
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Stoinis, , low full toss on middle, Stoinis drives firmly down the ground and it races away to the boundary
Manohar - Surprised that you think SRH was one of the favorites for the playoffs. Are you looking at the same team on paper as I am ?
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Stoinis, no run, good length outside off, Stoinis punches to extra cover
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Stoinis, no run, back of a length delivery slanted in on leg, Stoinis advances and then realises he doesn't have much room. So he quietly blocks it down the wicket
That must be out. Yes the finger goes up. But there's a review from Rahul.
Adil Rashid to Rahul,  Lbw!!

Adil Rashid to Rahul,  Lbw!! That must be out. Yes the finger goes up. But there's a review from Rahul. It's a legbreak that pitches around middle, straightens and hits the pad as Rahul misses the reverse-sweep. There's no bat involved and ball-tracking shows it's crashing into middle. Rahul knew he was gone and was walking off. He took the review just for the sake of it.
Shepherd given out LBW first ball, and he has reviewed it as well. But it won't save him. It's clipping leg stump.
Adil Rashid to Shepherd,  Lbw!!

Adil Rashid to Shepherd,  Lbw!! Shepherd given out LBW first ball, and he has reviewed it as well. But it won't save him. It's clipping leg stump. A googly from Rashid, and Shepherd doesn't pick it at all. He's clueless on the back foot as the ball turns in sharply to beat the inside edge and hitting the back leg.

Adil Rashid to Pooran, no run, gently punched into the off-side
Adil Rashid to Pooran, no run, gently punched into the off-side
Adil Rashid to Pooran, no run, flat legbreak turning in on middle and leg, Pooran turns it to midwicket
Adil Rashid to Pooran, no run, flat legbreak turning in on middle and leg, Pooran turns it to midwicket

T Natarajan to Stoinis, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Stoinis tries punching it through the off-side but gets a thick edge. It's a single to third man who's very fine, allowing him to cut this off

T Natarajan to Stoinis, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Stoinis tries punching it through the off-side but gets a thick edge. It's a single to third man who's very fine, allowing him to cut this off

T Natarajan to Pooran, 1 run, good length outside off, driven to deep point

T Natarajan to Stoinis, no run, slower length ball on off, Stoinis punches it firmly back to Natarajan

T Natarajan to Stoinis, 1 run, Stoinis advances, gets a high full toss and looks to swing it away. But he mistimes it wide of mid-off
T Natarajan to Pooran, , and that's a good way to finish it off! Slower length ball on off, Pooran swings hard and nails it over square leg for six!
T Natarajan to Pooran, , and that's a good way to finish it off! Slower length ball on off, Pooran swings hard and nails it over square leg for six!

Two wins out of two at home for LSG! And they've both come on very different pitches! Previous one was red soil and had more pace and bounce, and Mark Wood blew the opposition away. The one today was really sluggish with the ball gripping and holding, and LSG showed another dimension in their attack with the spinners bowling beautifully. Krunal Pandya, Ravi Bishnoi and Amit Mishra choked Sunrisers and never let them get away. They restricted them to a total of just 121 to set up the game for the hosts. Sunrisers needed to be right on the money with the ball to make a game of it. But that wasn't the case as there were just too many freebies on offer. And to make things worse, they had a very poor day on the field as well. With this defeat,  Plenty for them to ponder.

Not enough runs, tried to get to 150-160 but lost too many wickets and didnâ€™t get any momentum going. We realized it wasnâ€™t going to be a great wicket to bat in terms of history, but we were happy to fight. They bowled brilliantly according to the conditions. Good effort from our bowlers, we didnâ€™t give them enough runs to play with but they fought hard. (On the next home game) Different conditions once again, the team has played there already. The Punjab Kings are flying high but Sunday is a chance to pinch them.

I am feeling good. I have done a lot of hard work on my bowling and fielding. I know if I bowl faster it is easy to score for the batsmen. I try to vary my bowling. I try to do everything efficiently. I was very happy to take that catch. I think the red soil has more bounce and less spin. I canâ€™t say much about the black soil. It is keeping low but not turning much.

I am feeling good. I have done a lot of hard work on my bowling and fielding. I know if I bowl faster it is easy to score for the batsmen. I try to vary my bowling. I try to do everything efficiently. I was very happy to take that catch. I think the red soil has more bounce and less spin. I canâ€™t say much about the black soil. It is keeping low but not turning much.

Yesterday (when did he know how the pitch would play?). We've been here for a couple of weeks now. Knew what we were getting into (nature of the pitch). Even when Jaydev bowled a few cutters, it was gripping. Was a no-brainer to bowl spin early. First instinct when I saw both pitches was that we'll need to bat smartly here. We've adapted well as a batting unit. Each person plays very differently. Just have been a couple of chats with the batting group to help each other out. Good to see the players are going there and putting in the practice.

Yesterday (when did he know how the pitch would play?). We've been here for a couple of weeks now. Knew what we were getting into (nature of the pitch). Even when Jaydev bowled a few cutters, it was gripping. Was a no-brainer to bowl spin early. First instinct when I saw both pitches was that we'll need to bat smartly here. We've adapted well as a batting unit. Each person plays very differently. Just have been a couple of chats with the batting group to help each other out. Good to see the players are going there and putting in the practice.

Very good day at the office I can say. Both (what he enjoyed more?). Runs, wickets - everything is hard-earned. Everything is special. More right-handers in their lineup - knew I would be bowling four overs. This year I'm in a good headspace. Once you have clarity up there, things fall in places. I'm very process-driven, don't think about results. I took a break from cricket for a few months because I was just playing the white-ball formats, so wanted some time off to work on my bowling. What happened last two-three years was I kept getting wider and wider. Whatever I did in the last 3-4 months - getting taller and getting the ball to turn away, it is all coming out really well. People say I don't turn the ball, so that answers it I guess (Markram wicket). I'm trying to recollect how I played in the first 4-5 years in IPL where I was batting at four for MI. Trying to find that rhythm and consistency. Having the clarity helps. I'm okay with any track. Don't mind if I get a MoM. Want to dedicate this to my wife. She has been a constant support, she is who brings out the best version of myself.

Trying to find that rhythm and consistency. Having the clarity helps. I'm okay with any track. Don't mind if I get a MoM. Want to dedicate this to my wife. She has been a constant support, she is who brings out the best version of myself.

SRH have scored 131 and 121 in their two matches so far, while conceding scores of 203 and 127 (16 overs). Two crushing defeats with nothing going right in any department. Lots to ponder over. LSG, meanwhile, have bounced back nicely from their defeat against CSK. And they've done it while leaving Quinton de Kock on the bench, while also missing Mark Wood today due to illness.Â Such are the resources at their disposal. So that's all we have for now. Thanks for joining in. It's a goodbye from Sagar Chawla on behalf of Saurabh Shankar, Kumar Abhishek Das and Venky.
